channel.title: Add custom crowns for my newly added ranking system(unsolved)
channel.description: i made a new ranking system, called veteran (basically, how much you help, how long you have been playing, so on, so forth, i did not replace any ranking system like playerrights to make this, i made a seperate ranking system which players have in their char files)), but i have some custom icons (there are 5 veteran levels) how would i assign these icons to people so ingame the icon is next to their name ingame (like mod icons), so i have a green veteran icon, i want to assign this to the first level veteran icon (veteran = 1) yes this is all in my char files, so when you go in it says veteran = (number), anyways, back to my point, how do i assign it? deltascape im not sure if its client sided or server sided, so ill say my client too bluur EDIT:i used this tutorial: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,434949.0.html

item.title: Add custom crowns for my newly added ranking system(unsolved)
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

ok, so i have like 6 of these codes in my client.java, they look like this:

if(s1 != null && s1.startsWith("@cr1@")) //mod icons { s1 = s1.substring(5); byte0 = 1; } if(s1 != null && s1.startsWith("@cr2@")) { s1 = s1.substring(5); byte0 = 2; } if(s1 != null && s1.startsWith("@cr3@")) { s1 = s1.substring(5); byte0 = 5; } if(s1 != null && s1.startsWith("@cr4@")) { s1 = s1.substring(5); byte0 = 6; } if(s1 != null && s1.startsWith("@cr5@")) { s1 = s1.substring(5); byte0 = 7; } if(s1 != null && s1.startsWith("@cr6@")) { s1 = s1.substring(5); byte0 = 8; }
so what. would the next one be like
}
if(s1 != null && s1.startsWith("@cr7@")) {
s1 = s1.substring(5);
byte0 = 9;

item.title: Add custom crowns for my newly added ranking system(unsolved)
item.dc:creator: @EmulousGuru EmulousGuru
item.description:
@EmulousGuru wrote:

Search for @cr1@

Then declare other crowns for different variables/bytes.

Then increase the modIcons array index, and add the images to the cache.

item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

well i checked client sided, is it this?

[code]}
else if (s.startsWith(“modicon1”))
{
try
{
Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("./C:/.jrubscape_file_store_32/Sprites/MODICONS 1.png");
anInt1440 = 12;
anInt1441 = 11;
anIntArray1439 = new int[anInt1440 * anInt1441];
PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441, anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440);
pixelgrabber.grabPixels();

}
catch (Exception exception)
{
System.out.println(((Object) (exception)));
}
}[/code]
it was in class 30 sub 2 sub 1 sub 1, and in client.java, i found this:

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1Array1099[3] = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1("modicon2");

i searched modicon on my entire comp, but i couldnt find anything, i added the veticon names to the class 30 sub 2 sub 1 sub 1, but it didnt work
